lead_paragraph: The technology company agreed to pay $185 million on revenue generated in a 10-year period, a deal the government called a “major success.”
snippet: The technology company agreed to pay $185 million on revenue generated in a 10-year period, a deal the government called a “major success.”

headline.main: British Tax Deal With Google Puts Government on Defensive
headline.print_headline: Business Briefing; Cameron Defends Tax Deal With Google

abstract: Government of British Prime Min David Cameron defends 130 million-pound agreement reached with Google over back taxes, pushing back against criticism from political opposition and others within Cameron's conservative party.
